title: Genetic causes of poor sleep
body:
The Medical Research Council-funded study looked at data from 85,670 participants of UK Biobank and 5,819 individuals from three other studies, who wore accelerometers — wrist-worn devices (similar to a Fitbit) which record activity levels continuously. They wore the accelerometers… eCommerce web development

body:

excerpt: If you are feeling constantly tired, sluggish, and in a bad mood, and you have gained weight without an evident reason, you might be one of the 27 million who suffer from hypothyroidism, a malfunctioning of the tiny butterfly-shaped gland called thyroid.

title: Penn State Football: Nittany Lions' 2019 Schedule Analysis https://ift.tt/eA8V8J
description:
Change is in the air around the Penn State football program this year but the expectations remain the same. Despite a number of key players moving on from last year’s roster and a couple of staff changes, James Franklin’s mission is still to have a team capable of competing for a Big Ten championship in the fall.

summary: German town seizes family pet to cover unpaid dog tax The pedigree pug named Edda was seized by officials in the Rhineland town...
caption: German town seizes family pet to cover unpaid dog tax The pedigree pug named Edda was seized by officials in the Rhineland town of Ahlen last year after her owners failed to pay local taxes, including their dog tax. In a highly unusual step, the local authority offered Edda for sale on eBay for €750 (£650) to recoup the money.

title: Week 13-Troponin
body:
Some things you just have to learn the hard way which is how I learned what troponin is. My dad had a heart attack in November 2017 and my parents were asking me about blood tests, one specific test had to get done over again a few hours later and it was the Troponin test. The doctor came in and was telling us that the troponin levels were high which means my dad’s heart was damaged by not getting enough blood, which can result to a heart attack.

What is a troponin you may be asking, well it’s an enzyme that is released into our bloodstream when the cells of the heart are injured. Troponins are suppose to be checked every 2-6 hours, depending on the initial test, but some doctors check it every hour. Another test the doctors might do is a Creatine Kinase MB, which is a substance found in the heart muscles and other tissues.

Symptoms of a heart attack are pain or discomfort in the chest that may feel like a squeezing sensation or a sense of fullness, extreme tiredness, pain in other areas such as the neck, jaw, back, and/or arms, shortness of breath, lightheadedness or dizziness, nausea or vomiting, and sudden sweating. I think my dad said he had a just the discomfort in the chest area for a few days. He was having this pains during our Thanksgiving dinner and it just got too much for him so when my parents were visiting in Corvallis, they went to the emergency room and the doctor told him that if he didn’t come in that day my dad wouldn’t have lived.

There are some factors that can cause you to have a heart attack. For my dad it was really bad eating habits, smoking, drinking, the stress from work, and not getting enough physical activity so pretty much every factor. As of today April 2019, the doctor told my dad that his heart looks great and he wouldn’t have guessed that it ever got damaged. My dad quit smoking, which he was smoking for over 25+ years, he quit drinking heavy, my mom started making healthier meals and they cut back on the salt a whole lot, and they started working out together. You may think that it won’t happen to you or “you only live once” but honestly take care of your heart. If you have heart complications, you just got dealt with bad cards but don’t encourage it to get worse by eating awful foods, smoking and drinking, and not at least going for a 30 minute walk every day or so. Please take care of yourselves.

title: Things I’m Loving Friday #274
body:
Hey friends! Another weekend is upon us and I am psyched! This is the only “free” weekend we have in April with zero plans on the agenda so I’m excited to take full advantage of a clear calendar and live it up with my boys and Sadie… and by “live it up” I mean have some fun during the day and get everyone in bed by 8 p.m. Oh yesss! Big plans, big plans.

As for the past week, it was a good one! I shared a peek into our day on Wednesday on the blog yesterday but I also managed to squeeze in a dinner with girlfriends on Tuesday night and attended an event at Chase’s school yesterday morning which was all kinds of adorable. Seeing him on stage singing with his classmates just melted my heart!

Before unplugging and stepping away from the computer today, I wanted to keep things consistent around here and share a peek into my usual Things I’m Loving Friday roundup of favorites. Below you will see a short list of a few simple things that made me smile this week. As always, I’d love to hear a little bit about something you’re loving right now in the comments section.

I hope you all have a fantastic Friday and a great weekend!!

Things I’m Loving Friday 

  • New Kicks

The tracking that goes on behind the scenes of the internet is bad news for my wallet. After three days of seeing this pair of Adidas sneakers pop up in ads on my computer and my phone, I pulled the plug and bought them. No regrets! I knew I’d love them since I already have the olive green version of the same sneakers (Adidas Swift Run) and I’m a big-time fan of the rose pink color and deep purple detailing. I haven’t had pink sneakers in years and I’m all about it especially since the color seems very spring-appropriate right now! Plus, they were on clearance and it’s hard to beat brand new Adidas sneakers for only $42! (Note: If these sneakers caught your eye, order them in at least ½ size down from your usual sneaker size!)

  • Makeup Sponges (5 for $9!)

Ever since I started using makeup sponges to apply my concealer, I shudder to think back on the days when I used my fingertips to apply my makeup. Using makeup sponges not only makes my concealer easier to apply, but it makes it easier to blend into my skin and increases the longevity of the product since I don’t need to use as much. I recently stumbled upon a pack of 5 makeup sponges on Amazon for only $9 and the reviews were incredibly positive so I couldn’t resist placing an order, especially since a single makeup sponge can be $10-$20 depending on the brand. (Clearly I’m already using one, hence only four in the pic.) I’m happy to report that they work great and absolutely live up to the positive reviews. It was time for me to swap out my old sponges and I’m so glad I found this affordable option!

  • The Forgotten Room by Karen White, Beatriz Williams and Lauren Willig

My current obsession with Beatriz Williams novels most recently lead me to selecting The Forgotten Room, a collaborative novel by three talented authors, Williams along with Karen White and Lauren Willig. The book follows three generations of women, all connected by a single room in the formerly opulent Pratt Mansion. Now a private hospital in New York City in 1945, Captain Cooper Ravanel is under the care of Dr. Kate Schuyler, a talented doctor who bares a striking resemblance to a woman in a miniature portrait Captain Ravanel carries with him that he believes will tell him more about his father’s life. Kate has a myriad of questions about her own life and these questions are slowly answered as we follow the lives of Olive Van Allen, a servant in the Pratt Mansion in the Gilded Age who accepted the job to get answers to questions about her father’s suicide, and Lucy Young, a bright secretary living in the Jazz Age with questions about the identity of her father and her mother’s true love.

I was instantly hooked by this book and cannot recommend it enough, especially if you enjoy Beatriz Williams’ novels. I worried it would be a choppy read since three authors wrote the book together but it was seamless as well as deeply intriguing, exciting, heartbreaking and romantic.  I must admit I had a little trouble sorting out all of the characters and who was related to whom and all that as I read but I thoroughly enjoyed reading every character’s stories and loved trying to put the pieces that connected Kate, Lucy and Olive together.

  • Springtime Snow

We had quite the surprise on Tuesday morning when it began snowing in Charlotte! What!? By Wednesday morning it was sunny again and temperatures reached the 70s yesterday but that springtime snow threw everyone for a loop! It was beautiful to see snow flurries among the buds on the trees and the spring flowers blooming… but I’m also glad it was a bit of a weather fluke because I’m more than ready for winter to be d-o-n-e.

  • Friday Flashbacks

Starbucks Spinach Feta Wrap Recipe (A delicious make-at-home version of my favorite Starbucks breakfast!)

30 Minute Treadmill Interval Workout (A little bit of running, a little bit of incline walking… a lot of sweat!)

Question of the Day

What is one thing making you smile this week? 

The post Things I’m Loving Friday #274 appeared first on Peanut Butter Fingers.



from Health & Wellness https://www.pbfingers.com/things-im-loving-friday-274/
via http://www.rssmix.com/

  • The Forgotten Room by Karen White, Beatriz Williams and Lauren Willig

My current obsession with Beatriz Williams novels most recently lead me to selecting The Forgotten Room, a collaborative novel by three talented authors, Williams along with Karen White and Lauren Willig. The book follows three generations of women, all connected by a single room in the formerly opulent Pratt Mansion. Now a private hospital in New York City in 1945, Captain Cooper Ravanel is under the care of Dr. Kate Schuyler, a talented doctor who bares a striking resemblance to a woman in a miniature portrait Captain Ravanel carries with him that he believes will tell him more about his father’s life. Kate has a myriad of questions about her own life and these questions are slowly answered as we follow the lives of Olive Van Allen, a servant in the Pratt Mansion in the Gilded Age who accepted the job to get answers to questions about her father’s suicide, and Lucy Young, a bright secretary living in the Jazz Age with questions about the identity of her father and her mother’s true love.

I was instantly hooked by this book and cannot recommend it enough, especially if you enjoy Beatriz Williams’ novels. I worried it would be a choppy read since three authors wrote the book together but it was seamless as well as deeply intriguing, exciting, heartbreaking and romantic.  I must admit I had a little trouble sorting out all of the characters and who was related to whom and all that as I read but I thoroughly enjoyed reading every character’s stories and loved trying to put the pieces that connected Kate, Lucy and Olive together.

  • Springtime Snow

We had quite the surprise on Tuesday morning when it began snowing in Charlotte! What!? By Wednesday morning it was sunny again and temperatures reached the 70s yesterday but that springtime snow threw everyone for a loop! It was beautiful to see snow flurries among the buds on the trees and the spring flowers blooming… but I’m also glad it was a bit of a weather fluke because I’m more than ready for winter to be d-o-n-e.

  • Friday Flashbacks

Starbucks Spinach Feta Wrap Recipe (A delicious make-at-home version of my favorite Starbucks breakfast!)

30 Minute Treadmill Interval Workout (A little bit of running, a little bit of incline walking… a lot of sweat!)

Question of the Day

What is one thing making you smile this week? 

The post Things I’m Loving Friday #274 appeared first on Peanut Butter Fingers.



from Health & Wellness https://www.pbfingers.com/things-im-loving-friday-274/
via http://www.rssmix.com/

trail.content_raw:
Hey friends! Another weekend is upon us and I am psyched! This is the only “free” weekend we have in April with zero plans on the agenda so I’m excited to take full advantage of a clear calendar and live it up with my boys and Sadie… and by “live it up” I mean have some fun during the day and get everyone in bed by 8 p.m. Oh yesss! Big plans, big plans.

As for the past week, it was a good one! I shared a peek into our day on Wednesday on the blog yesterday but I also managed to squeeze in a dinner with girlfriends on Tuesday night and attended an event at Chase’s school yesterday morning which was all kinds of adorable. Seeing him on stage singing with his classmates just melted my heart!

Before unplugging and stepping away from the computer today, I wanted to keep things consistent around here and share a peek into my usual Things I’m Loving Friday roundup of favorites. Below you will see a short list of a few simple things that made me smile this week. As always, I’d love to hear a little bit about something you’re loving right now in the comments section.

I hope you all have a fantastic Friday and a great weekend!!

Things I’m Loving Friday 

  • New Kicks

The tracking that goes on behind the scenes of the internet is bad news for my wallet. After three days of seeing this pair of Adidas sneakers pop up in ads on my computer and my phone, I pulled the plug and bought them. No regrets! I knew I’d love them since I already have the olive green version of the same sneakers (Adidas Swift Run) and I’m a big-time fan of the rose pink color and deep purple detailing. I haven’t had pink sneakers in years and I’m all about it especially since the color seems very spring-appropriate right now! Plus, they were on clearance and it’s hard to beat brand new Adidas sneakers for only $42! (Note: If these sneakers caught your eye, order them in at least ½ size down from your usual sneaker size!)

  • Makeup Sponges (5 for $9!)

Ever since I started using makeup sponges to apply my concealer, I shudder to think back on the days when I used my fingertips to apply my makeup. Using makeup sponges not only makes my concealer easier to apply, but it makes it easier to blend into my skin and increases the longevity of the product since I don’t need to use as much. I recently stumbled upon a pack of 5 makeup sponges on Amazon for only $9 and the reviews were incredibly positive so I couldn’t resist placing an order, especially since a single makeup sponge can be $10-$20 depending on the brand. (Clearly I’m already using one, hence only four in the pic.) I’m happy to report that they work great and absolutely live up to the positive reviews. It was time for me to swap out my old sponges and I’m so glad I found this affordable option!

  • The Forgotten Room by Karen White, Beatriz Williams and Lauren Willig

My current obsession with Beatriz Williams novels most recently lead me to selecting The Forgotten Room, a collaborative novel by three talented authors, Williams along with Karen White and Lauren Willig. The book follows three generations of women, all connected by a single room in the formerly opulent Pratt Mansion. Now a private hospital in New York City in 1945, Captain Cooper Ravanel is under the care of Dr. Kate Schuyler, a talented doctor who bares a striking resemblance to a woman in a miniature portrait Captain Ravanel carries with him that he believes will tell him more about his father’s life. Kate has a myriad of questions about her own life and these questions are slowly answered as we follow the lives of Olive Van Allen, a servant in the Pratt Mansion in the Gilded Age who accepted the job to get answers to questions about her father’s suicide, and Lucy Young, a bright secretary living in the Jazz Age with questions about the identity of her father and her mother’s true love.

I was instantly hooked by this book and cannot recommend it enough, especially if you enjoy Beatriz Williams’ novels. I worried it would be a choppy read since three authors wrote the book together but it was seamless as well as deeply intriguing, exciting, heartbreaking and romantic.  I must admit I had a little trouble sorting out all of the characters and who was related to whom and all that as I read but I thoroughly enjoyed reading every character’s stories and loved trying to put the pieces that connected Kate, Lucy and Olive together.

  • Springtime Snow

We had quite the surprise on Tuesday morning when it began snowing in Charlotte! What!? By Wednesday morning it was sunny again and temperatures reached the 70s yesterday but that springtime snow threw everyone for a loop! It was beautiful to see snow flurries among the buds on the trees and the spring flowers blooming… but I’m also glad it was a bit of a weather fluke because I’m more than ready for winter to be d-o-n-e.

  • Friday Flashbacks

Starbucks Spinach Feta Wrap Recipe (A delicious make-at-home version of my favorite Starbucks breakfast!)

30 Minute Treadmill Interval Workout (A little bit of running, a little bit of incline walking… a lot of sweat!)

Question of the Day

What is one thing making you smile this week? 

The post Things I’m Loving Friday #274 appeared first on Peanut Butter Fingers.



from Health & Wellness https://www.pbfingers.com/things-im-loving-friday-274/
via http://www.rssmix.com/

summary: Textbooks redefined as microglia seen entering the Peripheral Nervous System.
title: Textbooks redefined as microglia seen entering the Peripheral Nervous System.
body:
Textbooks redefined as microglia seen entering the Peripheral Nervous System. Thoughts health innovators?

Inside the central nervous system (CNS), a region that includes the brain and spinal cord, it is the job of neuroimmune cells called microglia, to clean up cellular debris. Microglia have counterparts called macrophages that serve similar function outside the CNS in the peripheral nervous system (PNS), the region that contains most of the sensory and motor nerves.  It has long been believed that…

View On WordPress
